title: Virtual Equality: The Mainstreaming of Gay and Lesbian Liberation
description: A veteran activist tackles urgent questions about where the gay movement should go and what the movement wants with a unique combination of visionary politics and hard-earned pragmatism."A valuable, encyclopedic compendium of the gay movement’s modern history and challenges." — San Francisco ChronicleSince the decade to lift the ban on gays in the military, the emergence of gay conservatives, and the onslaught of antigay initiatives across America, the gay and lesbian community has been asking itself tough questions. In Virtual Equality, Urvashi Vaid offers wise answers.
author: Urvashi Vaid
